title: Cultures That Care About Bodycount
description:
Ready to build a network of amazing women and high-status men?

Michael’s Men of Action is a one-on-one Master’s program that teaches men how to create elite social lives by becoming higher status.

Click this link to learn how you can have a High-Status lifestyle now:
https://m.moamentoring.com/podcast

Click here to join the Men of Action community and watch the High-Status Networking 101 course:
https://m.moamentoring.com/moa-community

channel_info.title: Michael Sartain
channel_info.description:
🎙Host of The Michael Sartain Podcast 

🔥Teaching you how to build a network of desirable women and high-status men

👇 Click the "Men of Action" link below now to forge a high-status lifestyle and join the elites

transcription: {"text": "not just us, there's a study done by Dr. David Buss who wrote that book behind me. 37 culture study done in 1989 where they discuss body counts in men and women and of all these 37 cultures, do men care more about a woman's body count? Do women care more about a man's body count? And the thing that they found, and I'm sure this will be no surprise to you, is that women not only did not care if a man was a virgin, she thought it was very strange if a man was a virgin into his mid-20s and early 30s where he hadn't had sex with anyone, and men, while they cared about virginity, and in certain societies like in China, they cared very much about a woman's virginity, they cared less over time. Look, when they tried to replicate this study, this wasn't like a big deal. However, a woman's body count being lower was much more important to men, and for women, a man's body count just didn't mean anything at all. And I thought it was interesting when you interviewed all those girls at the gym and they were essentially saying what I just said.
